name: Ibis Bamberg Altstadt

reviews.text: For what we paid this was very good value for money. We booked an early non changeable deal through the IBIS website.
reviews.title: No Problems - good location
Loved the Ibis
reviews.text: The room was quite small but clean and the location was great.
Car parking was an extra charge of 9.50 euro and breakfast was also 9.50 euro each and was fine.
reviews.title: Small, smelly, awful

reviews.text: (Good italian pizzeria called Il Salino nearby)
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in Bamberg and I thought it was fantastic for the price. We were within walking distance to everything we wanted to see. The room was very clean and a nice size. The availability of a parking garage was very helpful and we were relieved by the very reasonable price of everything.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Excellent locationis ,located in downtown,Very quiet,PARKING FOR CAR ,VERY GOOD BREAKFAST
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: Perfect Location nearby the walking area; easy staying atmosphere, and very convenient. Nothing more than decent but worth every coin. Wish only there where free parking included and free Wifi. Not so common in Germany but is it asking too much nowadays ? OK, there was a desktop with free use and internet connection in the Lobby. Friendly and efficient staff at Reception Desk
reviews.title: Easy Place

reviews.text: Quite different from the usual Ibis hotel, this one is located in a quiet street on the edge of the old town, about 5 minutes walk from the Altes Rathaus. Instead of the usual concrete high-rise, the hotel is squeezed into an old town house, giving it quite an intimate and personal feel. The downside is that reception area can get quite busy, the small and woefully inadequate breakfast area even more so.
reviews.title: Cosy

reviews.text: Rooms were larger than expected, probably because we were in the attic space on the top floor. No proper air-co, as is the norm in German Ibis hotels, so only windows for cool air, fortunately the hotel is in a quiet part of town.
reviews.title: Good value and good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Quite a reasonable price, but the hotel loses a rating star due to its byzantine parking regulations. Squeezing a normal size family saloon car through the car park entrance was hard work enough, but that was nothing compared with the parking fascist working on front desk.
reviews.title: Perfect location, standard (clean) IBIS quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As I was checking in the lady asked if I needed to park my car. "Yes, I've already done so", which seemed to upset her no end, as she thrust a couple of photocopied A4 sheets under my nose. Noticing that they showed a map of the car park, I kindly pointed out that I had been good enough to use the dedicated hotel parking spaces and not those used by residents and businesses. But no, this was not good enough, I couldn't park in any old hotel parking space, I had to use the one space allocated to me. Go back downstairs and move your car into space X !
reviews.title: Accor could do better...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never stayed in an Ibis before, this place was quite a pleasant surprise. It's well located and all of the sights in Bamberg are just a few minutes walk. The room was nice and spacious although the bathrooms are quite small. It was a niggle having to pay extra for the carpark, but it was nice and secure.
reviews.title: Decent location, big rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ibis hotel is located in the theater district in Bamberg's old town. It is on a small quiet street. There is on location parking. The hotel is in a historic building which looks brand new inside. There is a lift and breakfast room, and 24 hour, front desk staffing.
reviews.title: Price + Location + Parking + New Hotel = Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very close to the old city, 5 minute walk to middle of everything. Not a 5 minutes of nothing walk, but a 5 amazing minute walk through Bamberg to the sites. I would suggest coming out of the hotel, making a right, at the first street, make a left then follow the river to the bridges into the old town. Nice walk.
reviews.title: Perfect
Basic Ibis-hotel in the heart of Bamberg
reviews.text: The room was nice and clean, with new furnishings. It was on the small side, but my rate was about 40% less than at other hotels of the same comfort and quality in the area. So I can take small when the rate was so much better than the surroundings.

description: The Ibis Bamberg hotel is located in the city centre, close to the main railway station, restaurants and the theatre district. The Convention Centre is 1.5 km away. The hotel has 50 pleasant and comfortable rooms, with shower and WC, direct telephoneline, satellite TV and internet access. Our bar serves snacks 24 hours. Secure pay parking is also available. Guests on a business trip will appreciate our WiFi wireless broadband Internet access.
